items.title: ConocoPhillips Says Port Arthur, North Field East LNG Projects Remain On Track
items.summary: ConocoPhillips said Thursday it expects the North Field East (NFE) LNG expansion project in Qatar to start up in the second half of this year, keeping global LNG supplies on track to continue surging as U.S. projects ramp up too.

items.title: Cold Snap Returns to Europe as U.S. LNG Supply Roars Back
items.summary: Markets are reacting to lingering cold settling over northern and eastern Europe in the coming days as a thawing United States ushers a surge of LNG volumes back into the international supply pool.

items.title: Winter Storm Fern Nearly Pushes 2026 Natural Gas Demand Into Growth Mode
items.summary: Lower 48 natural gas demand has come roaring back in February after a sluggish start to the year, with power burns and heating consumption jumping by double digits as cold weather grips the eastern half of the country. Year-to-date demand, however, r

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Spot Gas Slides as Brief Warm Break Curtails Demand Ahead of Renewed Cold
items.summary: Cash natural gas prices moved lower Thursday as a brief warming ahead of additional blasts of freezing weather was expected to trim regional natural gas demand.

items.title: MidDay Futures: Record EIA Storage Draw Misses Expectations, Sends Natural Gas Futures Lower
items.summary: The U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) reported a record natural gas storage withdrawal for the week ended Jan. 30. However, the draw came in smaller than expected, sending futures lower through midday as traders weighed the longer-range su

items.title: Natural Gas Forwards End Winning Streak as Volatility Eases, Forecasts Shift Warmer
items.summary: Natural gas forward prices eased over the past week as parts of the United States thawed out and market volatility stabilized following an historic winter storm that battered much of the country late last month.

items.title: Midmorning Markets: All-Time High Storage Pull Fails to Impress Natural Gas Futures Traders
items.summary: The U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) on Thursday said utilities withdrew 360 Bcf of natural gas from storage for the week ended Jan. 30. The record print reflected a brutal deep freeze in late January that sent heating demand soaring. The

items.title: Can Foreign Investment Save Venezuela’s Broken Oil Sector?

items.title: Russian Oil Discounts Widen for China as Indian Purchases Falter
items.summary: As India is tentatively pulling back from buying Russian oil after the U.S. trade deal, Russia’s crude is being offered in China at widening discounts to attract Chinese refiners, trade sources have told Reuters.     This week, the discount of the ES

items.title: How Policy Powered Guyana’s Oil Boom and Undermined Venezuela’s
items.summary: As the geopolitical map of South American oil shifts in early 2026, the contrast between Guyana and Venezuela has never been starker.  In global energy markets, geology is often treated as destiny. If a country has oil, investment and prosperity are

items.title: Lower Oil Prices Drag ConocoPhillips Q4 Profit Below Estimates
items.summary: ConocoPhillips (NYSE: COP) booked lower-than-expected earnings for the fourth quarter as higher production was unable to offset the decline in oil prices. ConocoPhillips reported on Thursday fourth-quarter adjusted earnings of $1.3 billion, or $1.02

items.title: Taiwan to Hike U.S. LNG Imports After Reaching Trade Deal
items.summary: After striking a trade and investment deal with the United States last month, Taiwan plans to hike imports of U.S. LNG this year to have American gas account for about a third of its supply. “We plan to increase purchases of natural gas from the U.S.

items.title: StanChart: Oil Market Rebalances as Oversupply Fears Fade Into 2026

items.title: Alberta Plans New Crude Oil Pipeline to Ship Energy Exports to Asia
items.summary: After years of antagonism between the federal government and Alberta over additional outlets for crude, Canada and the oil-producing province are finally on the same page regarding Canadian,/ oil exports. It took a major geopolitical and trade shift

items.title: Shell Weighs Multibillion Dollar Venezuela Gas Investments
items.summary: Shell’s CEO Wael Sawan told CNBC the company is actively considering multibillion-dollar offshore natural gas investments in Venezuela that could start production in the next few years, pending regulatory approvals. The comments mark one of the clear
